postsData.name:
‚úíÔ∏èClaire M. DavisüñãÔ∏è
‚úíÔ∏èClaire M. DavisüñãÔ∏è
postsData.content:
Early on, in interviews, 
I was afraid to admit I wasn't always
the best. That I made (shh!) mistakes...until...

*loosens collar*

...I realized I had to walk a hiring manager through my 1, 2 3...layoffs.

There is literally NO WAY to tell that story
without sharing a few imperfections here and there.
The hard lessons + serious learning curves along the way.

But you know what I found?

Those stories resonated BETTER
than the "I'm a perfect sales-and-marketer" ones ever did.

___________________________

If you're always the hero in your career stories,
you think you're coming off like a pro

but

it doesn't hit quite right.

___________________________
If you're always the hero you're making a mistake.

...you're missing the impact
...the grit and guts
...the humanity

and the connection with your target
(the Hiring Manager)

the reason?

>> You can't inspire others if they feel they could never "do it, too." <<

___________________________

The truth is, I didn't pop into the working world
with consultative selling stamped on my forehead.

I didn't happen to know the entire rolodex
of MDs and "connections" at Cedars-Sinai.

There wasn't a "foolproof business plan"
that was gifted to me by angels above.

___________________________

I learned it just like anyone else does.

Working
Studying
Feeling dumb
Trying
Failing
Doing It Anyway
Asking Others
Messing up
Tweaking
...and sometimes, winning ;)

___________________________

Think of a time you failed or struggled.

What happened to get you out to the other side?

THAT is how you tell a story that sticks and inspires others

___________________________

It creates connection
It brings interest
It binds you two

Yep.

Because, that person interviewing you?

THEY are not perfect either.

And they're sitting on the other side of the screen
PRAYING you're the right hire
so they can look good
to their investors
leadership
& clients

They're "putting their best foot forward."

So, if you want to break the ice.
Like crack and crush it,
show them that it's okay to "level with you."

When you admit that you've been there, too
and share what outside influences
or new strategies you tried
to overcome that hurdle,
you give them HOPE that they can overcome their challenges, too.

And instead of hinging your career story (only) on glorious wins -- try the glorious JOURNEY of getting to the win (and what challenges you overcame along the way)

It'll make your:

>> interview answers
>> promotion pitches
>> marketing / sales efforts

...stick.

You'll find a whole new kinship with those you're looking to impact.

And your words will carry a whole new gravity.

______________________

Did you try it?

______________________
postsData.commentAdded: Such a powerful reminder! Embracing our imperfections makes us relatable and inspires others. Authentic stories create genuine connections. üí™

Swarraj Kulkarni
Swarraj Kulkarni
postsData.content:
I am thrilled to have participated in the GITPRO World Conference 2025: Gen AI & Emerging Tech, in Milpitas, California! 

The event was an incredible platform for connecting with AI experts, startup founders, VCs, and visionaries driving innovation in Generative AI. I had the privilege of showcasing Yavi and demonstrating how our platform accelerates Gen AI-driven business and domain solutions and unlocks unparalleled value for enterprises.

Another highlight was joining the panel on No-Code platforms and tools, where I shared my thoughts on how to shape the future of this space.

Here are my key takeaways from the conference:
1. The GenAI opportunity is NOW‚Äîfocus on 10X impact and disruptive innovation.
2. With LLMs and infrastructure ecosystems stabilizing, the focus should shift to domain-specific, ROI-driven applications.
3. Build SaaS solutions for agents, empowering workflows and automation beyond just human users.

A huge thank you to the GITPRO organizers and volunteers for creating such a vibrant and engaging platform for collaboration. Events like these fuel innovation and inspire us to build a brighter future with technology.

postsData.name:
Unnati Lasiyal
Unnati Lasiyal
postsData.content:
Opportunities Are Everywhere‚Ä¶ But Are We Ready to See Them?

Opportunities surround us, yet many of us fail to notice them. Why? Because we're often stuck in the past or worried about the future, leaving us blind to the power of NOW.

The truth is, living in the present moment is the key to unlocking your potential and grabbing the opportunities right in front of you. Here's how we (yes, me too!) can start working on this:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Stop looking back.
Your past doesn‚Äôt define your present. You've grown, learned, and become more capable than you were before. Trust in your journey.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Appreciate the little wins.
Be grateful for the small moments‚Äîkind people, small recognitions, or even ticking off tasks from your to-do list. These moments make your NOW valuable.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Don't compare journeys.
Your beginning is not someone else's end. Everyone has ups and downs, even if it doesn‚Äôt seem that way. Focus on your unique path.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Trust the process.
Your work today is shaping your tomorrow. Don't stress about the future; just give your best to the present, and the rest will follow.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Believe in your unstoppable self.
You have the power to achieve everything you dream of‚Äîone step, one opportunity at a time.

So, let's stop chasing the past or fearing the future. Let's embrace NOW and make the most of every moment!

comments.commentText: Love this

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Embracing the present is vital for growth. Let‚Äôs seize every opportunity in our NOW! üåü #Mindfulness #GrowthMindset

Patient outcomes improve through early intervention and data-driven decisions. But scaling these solutions brings challenges in data security, latency, and reliability.

postsData.name:
Jon Brosio
Jon Brosio
postsData.content:
Posting just daily content to attract leads isn‚Äôt enough anymore.

Because most creators make three big mistakes.

Let‚Äôs break it down...

I worked with a coach who wanted to scale their business.

They were posting daily ‚Äî carousels, short-form, long-form you name it.

But something wasn‚Äôt clicking.

The content was valuable:

‚Ä¢ Guides
‚Ä¢ Checklists,
‚Ä¢ Infographics

The engagement was great:

‚Ä¢ Thousands of impressions
‚Ä¢ Scores of comments
‚Ä¢ Hundreds of likes

But the leads? Crickets.

Why?

They had commoditized themselves.

(The worst part is they didn't even know it).

People came for the free information but weren‚Äôt taking the next step.

We had to rethink everything.

Here‚Äôs what we did to turn it around:

Step 1: Tie all content back to their core offer.

Instead of just ‚Äúvaluable‚Äù posts, we created content that gave their audience clarity on the path to their goals.

Her offer became the foundation for every post. Each piece was like a puzzle piece, showing how they solved problems that no free checklist could.

Step 2: Share insights, not just value.

Value attracts freeloaders.
Insights attract serious buyers.

For example:

Value: ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs a checklist to grow your business.‚Äù

Insight: ‚ÄúMost people struggle to grow because they focus on X. Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve learned working with 100+ clients.‚Äù

One shows you know how to solve a problem.
The other shows why they need you to solve it.

Step 3: Speak to fears, frustrations, and desires.

We dug into the ICP‚Äôs pain points:

‚Ä¢ What keeps them awake at night?
‚Ä¢ What outcomes do they dream of achieving?
‚Ä¢ What frustrates them about their current situation?

Every post aimed to:

‚Ä¢ Show empathy.
‚Ä¢ Address those debilitating fears.
‚Ä¢ Paint a vision of what was possible (with their help).

The result?

Fewer likes and shares.

Way more DMs.

And an in inbound leads in 30 days.

Daily content can‚Äôt just attract.
It has to awaken your sleeping leads.

Here‚Äôs the formula:

‚Ä¢ Let offer guide the content.
‚Ä¢ Emphasize insights over value.
‚Ä¢ Target fears, frustrations, desires.

Do this and watch your audience turn into clients.

---

On January 27th I'm doing a live training.

You'll walk away with:

30 days of lead-generating content Created in less than 20 minutes

That attracts your dream client

This link will tell you more about it:

postsData.name:
Jonathan H. Westover, PhD, MPA, AF-CIPD, SFHEA
Jonathan H. Westover, PhD, MPA, AF-CIPD, SFHEA
postsData.content:
Check out my latest Human Capital Leadership Review article, "Managing Panic Attacks at Work: Practical Strategies for Leaders and Employees."

Abstract: The article explores strategies for managing panic attacks in the workplace, informed by research. It first provides an overview of what constitutes a panic attack and how to recognize the symptoms. It then outlines coping techniques for individuals experiencing an attack, such as deep breathing, muscle relaxation, and self-talk. The article also discusses the role of leaders in accommodating employees with panic disorders through confidentiality, flexible schedules, and open communication. Additionally, it highlights how coworkers can provide support by checking in, offering calming aids, and shielding the individual from disruption. Lastly, the article recommends that employers establish comprehensive support systems, including mental health education, designated allies, benefits, and anti-stigma policies, to cultivate a workplace environment that prioritizes mental wellness alongside performance. Overall, the article emphasizes the importance of implementing evidence-based strategies to manage panic attacks respectfully and effectively, benefiting both employers and employees.

Take a look at or listen to the full article and leave your comments below!
postsData.commentAdded: This is such an important topic! Supporting mental health in the workplace is key to fostering a positive and productive environment. Great insights!

postsData.name:
Machine Learning Community (Moderated)
Machine Learning Community (Moderated)
postsData.content:
Roadmap to Master Prompt Engineering: Step-by-Step Guide

1. AI Fundamentals
Start with the basics by understanding AI, ML concepts, and natural language processing (NLP).

2. Prompting Basics
Learn to craft initial prompts and analyze AI responses effectively for better results.

3. Types of Prompts
Experiment with informative and creative prompts to explore their potential applications.

4. Prompt Formulation
Use concise language and define specific goals to achieve precise outputs.

5. Testing Prompts
Test and analyze responses to refine prompts and improve relevance.

6. Iterative Refinement
Continuously refine prompts to optimize clarity and information delivery.

7. Contextual Prompting
Set clear contexts to control the scope of AI outputs effectively.

[ Explore more in the post ]

comments.commentText: Activation functions are key to neural networks! They introduce non-linearity, allowing models to capture complex patterns. Without them, the network would be limited to linear relationships, making learning intricate data structures impossible.
Good to know!

postsData.commentAdded: Great roadmap! Mastering prompt engineering can truly unlock the full potential of AI. Excited to see how these steps enhance our AI applications!

postsData.content:
Do you ever look at your big goals and feel completely overwhelmed?

Here‚Äôs the secret: You don‚Äôt have to tackle everything at once. Success is built one small step at a time.

Waking up 10 minutes earlier to journal.

Sending that email you‚Äôve been avoiding.

Taking 5 minutes to plan your priorities for the day.

These small actions may not seem like much, but over time, they create momentum.

So today, ask yourself:

What‚Äôs one small win I can create right now?

How can I celebrate the progress I‚Äôm making, no matter how small?

Because success isn‚Äôt about doing everything at once‚Äîit‚Äôs about doing the next right thing, one step at a time.
postsData.commentAdded: Great reminder! It‚Äôs often the small steps that lead to significant progress. Celebrating those wins keeps us motivated! What‚Äôs your small win today?

postsData.name:
Raghav Balasubramanian
Raghav Balasubramanian
postsData.content:
A-players punch above their weight class.

The secret is stupidly simple.

Prioritization - they are masters at it!

Here are 5 habits they never waste time on:

1. Chasing Perfection
‚Ü≥ A-players understand that perfection is the enemy of progress.
‚Ü≥ They focus on getting things done efficiently instead of obsessing over every tiny detail.

2. Saying Yes to Everything
‚Ü≥ Top performers know their limits.
‚Ü≥ They say ‚Äúno‚Äù to tasks that don‚Äôt align with their goals or priorities.

3. Overthinking Decisions
‚Ü≥ Instead of getting stuck in analysis paralysis, A-players make decisions quickly.
‚Ü≥ They trust their instincts & use feedback to improve.

4. Micromanaging
‚Ü≥ Top performers trust their team.
‚Ü≥ They delegate effectively & empower others to take ownership of tasks.

5. Unnecessary Meetings
‚Ü≥ A-players avoid long, unproductive meetings that don‚Äôt have a clear agenda or outcome.
‚Ü≥ If it can be solved in an email or quick chat, they‚Äôll take that route.

Mastering the art of prioritization is what separates top performers from the rest.

Which of these habits do you struggle with?

If you found this post helpful, Ô∏è repost this to your network & givea follow for more!

comments.commentText:
Fully agree. There's a trap though in fast decision making that's worth mentioning. Most of the time, you need some level of input. Your team and peers probably have insights that are relevant. Make sure they are heard. That you've thoughtfully considered.

Fast decision making is often a mask for someone who can't tolerate a bit of uncertainty.
Ian Christie Absolutely! Fast decisions can overlook key insights. Thanks for the comment.

Raghav Balasubramanian I think this comes with time and experience. When you realise that your time is a limited resource, you cannot do everything at once, or you cannot do all things, you stop overthinking and just run. Meetings require much time, so you should ask the right questions to see if you can achieve without the meeting.
Audra A. Beautifully put

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Mastering prioritization truly sets A-players apart. I struggle with overthinking decisions‚Äîdefinitely a work in progress!

postsData.name:
Olivia Diallo üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà
Olivia Diallo üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà
postsData.content:
No one is reading your emails because they're way too long.




One of's recent posts made me recall an article from Gong I read last year: according to their data, no one is reading emails longer than can fit on a phone screen.

And, anecdotally, this is so true.

Enter, "The Phone Screen Test:" If it's longer than can fit on a phone screen, I edit the email.

I mean it‚Äì trim the fat. Don't get into the weeds about your 15 integrations. Definitely get rid of the salutation.

When I started doing this, my reply rates nearly doubled AND the folks I was able to reach were closer to my ideal ICP. This makes sense‚Äì C-suite at fast-growing companies don't have time to read novel-length emails.

The sweet spot is spending time on personalization (love some
, thanksand!) while making sure the email is direct and brief. That way, the personalization effort you put in has a much higher chance of actually being read.

postsData.name:
V√©ronique Barrot
V√©ronique Barrot
postsData.content:
11 Brutal Career Truths 

You Need to Hear Today

Success doesn‚Äôt happen overnight.
It‚Äôs built through tough lessons and smart moves.

Here‚Äôs the truth:

Top performers don‚Äôt wait for opportunities to fall into their lap.
They face challenges head-on and keep pushing forward.

Master these 11 truths to grow
Your career and mindset:

1. Mistakes are unavoidable - so is the growth they spark
‚Ü≥ Every setback carries a lesson.
‚Ü≥ The sooner you embrace failure, the faster you progress.

2. Anxiety is a sign, not a roadblock.
‚Ü≥ Discomfort often means it‚Äôs time to level up.
‚Ü≥ Growth lives outside your comfort zone.

3. Every job is a stepping stone.
‚Ü≥ Absorb, contribute, and keep evolving.
‚Ü≥ No experience is wasted if you apply what you learn.

4. Failures don‚Äôt define you, but your response does.
‚Ü≥ Resilience matters more than perfection.
‚Ü≥ Keep moving forward, no matter what.

5. Your reputation is your greatest asset.
‚Ü≥ It follows you everywhere - guard it wisely.
‚Ü≥ Trust is built over time but lost in seconds.

6. Success isn‚Äôt luck - it‚Äôs built daily.
‚Ü≥ Hard work compounds over time.
‚Ü≥ Stay focused on long-term wins.

7. Burnout is real - protect your energy.
‚Ü≥ Sustainable success requires balance.
‚Ü≥ Your well-being fuels your career longevity.

8. Trust, but always verify.
‚Ü≥ Healthy skepticism protects you from costly mistakes.
‚Ü≥ Blind trust can derail your career.

9. Know your value - and own it.
‚Ü≥ Confidence isn‚Äôt arrogance; it‚Äôs self-awareness.
‚Ü≥ Don‚Äôt sell yourself short to fit in.

10. Credibility takes years to build, seconds to lose.
‚Ü≥ Integrity and consistency are everything.
‚Ü≥ Every decision shapes your professional legacy.

11. Work friendships need boundaries.
‚Ü≥ Relationships matter, but professionalism comes first.
‚Ü≥ Don‚Äôt blur the lines at the cost of your growth.

Success isn‚Äôt about luck‚Äîit‚Äôs about habits.

 Which lesson hit home for you?
Drop it in the comments below ‚¨áÔ∏è

Ô∏è Repost to help someone who needs to hear these brutal career truths today.
 Followfor more actionable career growth insights.

comments.commentText: I completely agree with the point about burnout being real and the importance of protecting your energy V√©ronique Barrot. As leaders, we often feel the pressure to give our all at work, but sustainable success is rooted in balance.

postsData.content:
Why did we choose Titanium Ventures?

postsData.name:
Josh Streets
Josh Streets
postsData.content: A well written piece that I was interviewed for by CX Dive. A simple feature that should be enabled on any call queue (especially inbound sales).

comments.commentText:
Great insights on the dearth of callbacks, Josh!

It's interesting that companies would avoid callbacks as a way of "punishing" customers who call by subjecting them to long wait times.

Callbacks can help reduce costs in this situation. They can smooth the demand curve and reduce customer frustration.

In one study of 29,000+ calls, handle time increased 25% when the customer became angry after calling. That 25% waste seems like a far easier target for cost-savings!

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Enabling this feature can truly enhance customer experiences and streamline sales processes. Looking forward to more discussions!

postsData.name:
Dr. Carrie LaDue
Dr. Carrie LaDue
postsData.content:
The best leadership advice I can give you for the next decade: 

(Here‚Äôs what you need to lead the future):

I‚Äôve worked with thousands of leaders.

A pattern I‚Äôve observed in all of them:

The ones who thrive in the next decade won‚Äôt be the ones who grind harder.

They‚Äôll be the ones who:
- Lean into change
- Adapt with purpose
- Embrace the trends reshaping leadership

Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs coming and how you can get ahead of it:

1) The rise of AI and technology

AI isn‚Äôt going away.

If you want to win, stop trying to outwork the machines.

Instead, figure out how to use them.

You need to ask:
- ‚ÄúWhat tools actually help us achieve our goals?‚Äù
- ‚ÄúWhich ones are a waste of our time?‚Äù

Upskilling your team (and yourself) is non-negotiable.

2) Deep connection in a tech-driven world

As technology handles more tasks, people are craving something machines can‚Äôt give:

Real connection.

Leaders who create cultures of belonging will thrive.

It‚Äôs about being present.
And letting your people know they matter.

3) Intentional growth and learning

The pace of change isn‚Äôt slowing down.

Neither can you.

Leaders who prioritize learning‚Äîboth for themselves and their teams‚Äîwill stay ahead.

Build a culture where curiosity and growth are part of the DNA, and you‚Äôll be ready for whatever comes next.

P.S. What trends are you noticing in leadership currently?

Let's discuss in the comments below.

Thanks for reading.

Enjoyed this post?

Followfor more insights on leadership and high performance‚Äîand share this post with your network.

If you‚Äôre ready to lead the future with confidence, pre-order my book, ‚ÄòThe Trifecta: When Excellence Becomes the Enemy.‚Äô

It‚Äôs available until February 10th.

Visit the link in the comments to pre-order now.
